title: VNC connections drop
author: rtuite
body_snippet:
Connection to VNC clients drops randomly.

## Expected Behavior
Keep connections alive

## Current Behavior
The connection drops randomly every few minutes. No error is presented. The connection may drop after a minute or 2 or sometimes 10 to 15 or not at all. It's kind of random but improves with subsequent reconnects. After 2 or 3 reconnects, it seems fine. I've been able to confirm the issue also happens with another person in another state to the same servers. 

## Steps to Reproduce...

comments.author: scottcopus
comments.snippet: Frequent disconnects for me too, although we mostly use UltraVNC's server occasionally in our environment.  The UltraVNC client typically has no issues.

comments.author: Swizzler121
comments.snippet: Same here. I've noticed it happens more frequently when something is running fullscreen on the host machine (like firefox or virtualbox), although I don't understand how that would affect the viewer in any way. When it's not disconnecting, mouse movement is poorly responsive and slow. If I shut down the fullscreen apps the connection stabilizes. The issue isn't the host, running the apps direct on the machine are snappy and have no issues.

comments.author: sicklittlemonkey
comments.snippet:
Using mRemoteNG 1.76.20 (2019-04-12) I connect to these versions of TightVNC:
- Version 2.8.8 (built on Mar 14 2017 at 11:46:46) - works fine
- Version 2.8.27 (built on Oct 15 2019 at 14:13:56) basically doesn't work - black screen

So if you could get old builds and/or source of TightVNC you could perhaps compare the protocol to see what's changed, or install newer versions until it breaks and then check for source code differences.

comments.author: flyingwolf79
comments.snippet:
This is a recurring issue for me as well. 

If the remote machine has any of the programs full-screened then the connection will drop at random and show that I closed the connection.

This is also true if the machine is on the login screen. 

However, if there is a full-screen windowed program it maintains the connection without issue.

comments.author: Vanderdecken
comments.snippet: I've seen this regularly on at least 5 different clients and 25+ different servers over the past year or two. Anecdotally the chance of the VNC connection closing appears to be higher if there's a lot of activity on the session, both fast-moving imagery on screen increasing screen refreshes, and many quick user actions e.g. clicks on the session. It's a lower chance of the problem happening if the remote machine has a static display, low interaction over the session and low CPU/GPU load. We can ...
